page.title: 02Housing
page.content: Over 30% of the houses in the area were built before 1900, a number dating from the Elizabethan period or earlier. There are a considerable number of Grade II and Grade III properties including Walkern Old Rectory, a number of farmhouses, 25 houses or cottages in the High Street, the Vicarage at Ardeley and the houses surrounding the Green. There was a significant amount of house-building during the 20's and 30's. Fifty per cent of the houses have however been erected since 1945, including council housing, and there are two substantial estates in Walkern. There are still a number of tied cottages owned by local farmers and a handful of cottages in Ardeley owned by the Church. Walkern is one of 8 villages in East Herts where planning permission bay be granted for infill development.
